problem.para: For each of the statements below determine if it is true or false.
Any two nonzero vectors in \RNr[2] represent an orientation of \RNr[2].

solution.para: If \Vect{x}\neq\Vect{0} is a nonzero vector of \RNr[2], then the ordered pair (\Vect{x},\Vect{x}) consists of nonzero vectors as well.
However, the vectors in the pair (\Vect{x},\Vect{x}) are parallel. So they do not represent an orientation of \RNr[2]; the statement in question is false.

problem.para: If \Vect{u}\neq \Vect{0} is a vector in \RNr[2], then the pair (\Vect{u}, 2 \Vect{u}) represents the positive orientation of \RNr[2].

solution.hint.para: Review the solution of the previous problem.

problem.para: If the oriented volume of the ordered triple (\Vect{a},\Vect{b},\Vect{c}) of vectors in \RNr[3] is positive, then (\Vect{a},\Vect{b},\Vect{c}) represents the right hand orientation of \RNr[3].
